result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristin N Sammons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with: Marya W., her family, her residence, or their residences; direct or indirectly.  
  No contact with: Rick P., his family, extended family, or their residences; directly or indirectly.
No access to any social media accounts.
  Forfeiture of any personal information of the victims and their families, including passwords, social security numbers, or any account information.  
  Forfeiture of the Apple iPhone 6, Apple iPhone 6 Plus, Apple iPad being held by the New Berlin Police Department.  Remaining property may be returned to the defendant.
  Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

To be determined at restitution hearing.  Bail money to be held until restitution hearing.
1/12/2017 - COURT SETS RESTITUTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,995.17 FOR M.W.  CASH BAIL APPLIED AND BALANCE OF BAIL HELD FOR NEXT RESTITUTION HEARING.

3/20/2017 - COURT DENIES MR. PURKO'S REQUEST FOR RESTITUTION BECAUSE HE DOES NOT QUALIFY AS A VICTIM UNDER THE LAW FOR THE CHARGES CONTAINED IN THE JUDGMENT OF CONVICTION.  $2,500.00 CASH BAIL REFUNDED AND FORWARDED TO ATTORNEY BRENNAN AND BALANCE OF CASH BAIL REFUNDED TO POSTER. .

timeConds.notes: FIRST 6 months STRAIGHT TIME.  Sentence credit of 6 days was granted.  LAST 6 months NON-WORKING hours with standard release conditions.  Sentence commencing forthwith.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision.   Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Certified copy of order dated June 6, 2018.
It is ordered that the judgment and order of the circuit court are summarily affirmed pursuant to Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  It is further ordered that Attorney Suzanne Hagopian is relieved of further representation of Kristin Sammons in these matters.  It is further ordered that this summary disposition order will not be published.
Dated 7/10/18 filed by the Court of Appeals.

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing on March 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits signed and filed.  Exhibits shall be disposed of pursuant to the signed Stipulation and Order and based on the retention period for exhibits in SCR 72.01(46).  Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.
Exhibit 1

Defendant Kristin N Sammons in court, in custody, with attorney Patrick Cavanaugh Brennan.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address restitution being requested.  The State just received a restitution request from R.P.   The Court will not address restitution being requested by R.P. today due to the late filing.  Attorney Brenen to file his position whether R.P. qualifies as a victim in the case by 2/10/17 and the State is to file a response by 2/20/17.  The Court schedules the case for an additional restitution hearing for 3/24/17 at 1:30.  If the Court renders a decision prior to the hearing, the hearing scheduled on 3/24/17  will be removed from the Court's calendar.   The Court will proceed with the restitution hearing in regards to restitution being requested by M.W.  The State calls M.W. to testify.  M.W. is sworn in.  Exhibit 1 is marked and admitted into evidence.  The State conducts direct examination of the witness.  Attorney Brennan conducts cross-examination of the witness.   The witness is excused.    Attorney Brennen calls the Defendant to testify.  The Defendant is sworn in and Attorney Brennan conducts direct examination of the witness.   Attorney Galaviz conducts cross-examination of the witness.    The parties present closing statements.  The Court sets restitution in the amount of $1,995.17 payable to M.W.  (apply cash bail on file in this case and  the remaining posted bail is to remainon file until after restittuion has been determined for R.P at the upcoming restitution hearing).  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Restitution hearing on January 11, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Kristin N Sammons in court with attorney Patrick Cavanaugh Brennan.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #2:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT;
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  Marya W., her family, or her residence, direct or indirectly.
*No contact with Rick P. , his family, extended family, or their residences; direct or indirectly.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*No access to any social media accounts.
*Forfeiture of any  personal information of the victims and their families, including passwords, social security numbers,or any account information. 
*Forfeiture of the Apple 6 phone, Apple 6 plus phone, Apple IPAD being held by the New Berlin Police Department.  Remaining property may be returned to the Defendant.

RESTITUTION:  TBD at restitution hearing (bail money to be held until restitution hearing);

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 1 YEAR, FIRST 6 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME (APPLY 6 DAY CREDIT), LAST 6 MONTHS NON-working Hours with standard release conditions.  Defendant remanded into custody and sentence to commence forthwith. 

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on December 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 21, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kristin N Sammons in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Lawn Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sonderhouse advises the Court that the Defendant has requested Attorney Pat Brennan represent her on the cases.  The Defendant confirms Attorney Sonderhouse statement to the Court.  Attorney Pat Brennan appears in Court and advises the Court that he will represent the Defendant if the Court adjourns the trial and allows additional time for him to review the cases.  The State does not object.  The Court grants the motion and Attorney Pat Brennan is now counsel of record.  The Court adjourns the trial and reschedules the trial.   Attorney Brennan to prepare a substitution and order of counsel and file with the Court.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
